Hi,

I've been digging some more into the source code and have been
learnin=
g a little c# along the way.  Nothing like a trial by fire I
suppose.

Anyw=
ay, I'm slowly making progress, but I've been stuck for hours on
what I'm s=
ure is a really simple fix, so I turn to you guys for help...

I wrote the =
following code into Form1.cs, after the
stopSearchSignal=3Dtrue; line of th=
e btnSearchStop_Click function:


SaveBestNetwork("-local file name-");
			=

INetwork nt =3D ea.BestGenome.Decode(selectedActivationFunction);
			
INet=
workEvaluator.ExtractNetworkPerformance(nt);



With the goal of having sha=
rpNEAT automatically write the best network
to a file and run my ExtractNet=
workPerformance function right before
it closes.  The ExtractNetworkPerform=
ance function is very similar to
the regular EvaluateNetwork function in al=
l the experiment's folders,
in that is accepts an INetwork as input and pus=
hes signals through the
network.  The difference is that I'm not calculatin=
g a fitness level,
only recording the output signals and writing them to a =
file so I can
later take a look at what the most fit network's decisions we=
re.

The problem is that when I try to compile the above code, I get the
er=
ror: "An object reference is required for the nonstatic field,
method, or p=
roperty
'SharpNeatLibExperiments.INetworkEvaluator.ExtractNetworkPerformanc=
e(SharpNeatLib.NeuralNetwork.INetwork)'(CS0120)

Could someone please let m=
e know what's wrong?  I've been banging my
head against this for an entire =
day now.

Thanks,
Matt
